channel.title: Azure AI Foundry Model Updates
channel.description: Latest updates on Azure AI Foundry models sold directly by Azure

item.title: gpt-5.2-codex
item.description: GPT-5.2 Codex is a reasoning-capable model optimized for coding workflows, including Codex CLI and the Codex VS Code extension. It supports both Chat Completions and Responses APIs with structured outputs, multimodal (text+image) processing, and advanced tool/function calling including parallel tool calls.

item.title: gpt-5.2
item.description: GPT-5.2 is a large-context reasoning model for general-purpose chat and responses. It supports structured outputs, multimodal text+image processing, and function/tool calling including parallel tool calls across both Chat Completions and Responses APIs.

item.title: gpt-5.2-chat
item.description: GPT-5.2-chat is a preview chat-oriented model available via Chat Completions and Responses APIs. It supports structured outputs and tool/function calling (including parallel tool calls), but is marked preview and not recommended for production use.

item.title: gpt-5.1
item.description: GPT-5.1 is a reasoning model supporting Chat Completions and Responses APIs with structured outputs, multimodal text+image processing, and tool/function calling including parallel tool calls. The documentation notes reasoning_effort defaults to none, so callers may need to explicitly set reasoning_effort to enable reasoning behavior.

item.title: gpt-5.1-chat
item.description: GPT-5.1-chat is a preview reasoning-enabled chat model for Chat Completions and Responses APIs. It includes built-in reasoning capabilities and, like other reasoning models, does not support parameters such as temperature.

item.title: gpt-5.1-codex
item.description: GPT-5.1-codex is a coding-optimized model available via the Responses API only, with multimodal text+image processing and structured outputs. It supports functions/tools and parallel tool calling and is optimized for Codex CLI and the Codex VS Code extension.

item.title: gpt-5.1-codex-mini
item.description: GPT-5.1-codex-mini is a Responses-API-only Codex-optimized model with multimodal text+image processing and structured outputs. It supports functions/tools and parallel tool calling and is intended for coding workflows via Codex CLI and the Codex VS Code extension.

item.title: gpt-5.1-codex-max
item.description: GPT-5.1-codex-max is a Responses-API-only Codex model that extends reasoning controls, including support for reasoning_effort set to xhigh. It supports multimodal text+image processing, structured outputs, and advanced tool/function calling including parallel tool calls.

item.title: gpt-5
item.description: GPT-5 is a large-context reasoning model supporting Chat Completions and Responses APIs. It provides structured outputs, multimodal text+image processing, and function/tool calling including parallel tool calling for complex workflows.

item.title: gpt-5-mini
item.description: GPT-5-mini is a reasoning-capable GPT-5 family model designed for strong capability with potentially lower cost/latency than the full model. It supports Chat Completions and Responses APIs, structured outputs, multimodal text+image processing, and parallel tool calling.

item.title: gpt-5-nano
item.description: GPT-5-nano is a smaller GPT-5 family reasoning model intended for efficiency. It supports Chat Completions and Responses APIs with structured outputs, multimodal text+image processing, and tool/function calling including parallel tool calls.

item.title: gpt-5-chat
item.description: GPT-5-chat is a preview chat model that accepts text and image input and returns text output via Chat Completions and Responses APIs. A later preview version (2025-10-03) adds enhancements focused on emotional intelligence and mental health conversations.

item.title: gpt-5-codex
item.description: GPT-5-codex is a Responses-API-only model optimized for coding use cases and Codex tooling. It supports structured outputs, multimodal text+image input, and tool/function calling including parallel tool calling.

item.title: gpt-5-pro
item.description: GPT-5-pro is a GPT-5 family reasoning model available via the Responses API with structured outputs and multimodal text+image processing. It supports functions and tools for advanced orchestration scenarios and requires registration for access.

item.title: gpt-oss-120b
item.description: gpt-oss-120b is an open-weight reasoning model (preview) for text-in/text-out chat scenarios. It supports streaming, function calling, and structured outputs, and can be deployed (notably requiring a Foundry project for deployment).

item.title: gpt-oss-20b
item.description: gpt-oss-20b is a smaller open-weight reasoning model (preview) for text-in/text-out chat. It supports streaming, function calling, and structured outputs, and is available via managed compute and Foundry Local.

item.title: gpt-4.1
item.description: gpt-4.1 is a multimodal (text+image input) model with text output, available via Chat Completions and Responses APIs with streaming, function calling, and structured outputs (Chat Completions). The page notes a known issue where very large tool/function definitions over ~300,000 tokens can fail despite the larger context limit.

item.title: gpt-4.1-mini
item.description: gpt-4.1-mini is a smaller variant of the GPT-4.1 multimodal family, supporting text+image input and text output via Chat Completions and Responses APIs. It includes streaming, function calling, and structured outputs (Chat Completions), and shares the documented large-tool-definition failure issue affecting the 4.1 series.

item.title: gpt-4.1-nano
item.description: gpt-4.1-nano is the smallest GPT-4.1 series variant with multimodal text+image input and text output. It supports Chat Completions and Responses APIs with streaming, function calling, and structured outputs (Chat Completions), and is subject to the same known issue around extremely large tool/function definitions.

item.title: computer-use-preview
item.description: computer-use-preview is an experimental model trained to work with the Responses API computer use tool, enabling mouse/keyboard control with screenshot context. It supports tools and streaming with text input/output and image input, and requires registration for access.

item.title: codex-mini
item.description: codex-mini is a fine-tuned version of o4-mini focused on coding and tool-driven workflows. It is available via the Responses API with structured outputs, multimodal text+image processing, and functions/tools support, and is available in East US2 and Sweden Central (Global Standard).

item.title: o3-pro
item.description: o3-pro is an o-series reasoning model designed for advanced problem solving with increased focus and capability. It supports the Responses API with structured outputs, multimodal text+image processing, and functions/tools, and is available in East US2 and Sweden Central (Global Standard).

item.title: o4-mini
item.description: o4-mini is a newer reasoning model offering enhanced reasoning abilities for tasks like science, coding, and math. It supports Chat Completions and Responses APIs with structured outputs, multimodal text+image processing, and functions/tools.

item.title: o3
item.description: o3 is a reasoning model with enhanced reasoning abilities and support for parallel tool calling. It supports Chat Completions and Responses APIs with structured outputs and multimodal text+image processing for complex problem-solving workflows.

item.title: o3-mini
item.description: o3-mini is a text-only o-series model focused on enhanced reasoning with structured outputs and functions/tools. It is positioned as a smaller reasoning option within the o-series lineup.

item.title: o1
item.description: o1 is an o-series reasoning model with enhanced reasoning abilities, structured outputs, and multimodal text+image processing. It supports functions and tools for advanced task execution.

item.title: o1-preview
item.description: o1-preview is an older preview version of the o1 series. The page notes it is only available to customers who were granted access as part of the original limited access program.

item.title: o1-mini
item.description: o1-mini is a faster and more cost-efficient o1-series option, described as ideal for coding tasks requiring speed and lower resource consumption. Global Standard deployment is available by default, while standard (regional) deployments are limited to select customers from the o1-preview limited access release.

item.title: gpt-4o
item.description: gpt-4o (Omni) is a multimodal model that integrates text and images, improving responsiveness and vision/non-English performance while maintaining strong English and coding parity with GPT-4 Turbo. It supports structured outputs, JSON mode, and parallel function calling, with multiple dated versions listed.

item.title: gpt-4o-mini
item.description: gpt-4o-mini is a fast, inexpensive multimodal model positioned as an ideal replacement for GPT-3.5 Turbo series models. It supports text and image processing, JSON mode, and parallel function calling.

item.title: gpt-4 (turbo-2024-04-09)
item.description: GPT-4 Turbo with Vision (turbo-2024-04-09) is a generally available model and replacement for earlier GPT-4 preview models such as vision-preview, 1106-Preview, and 0125-Preview. It can be used only with the Chat Completions API, and feature availability varies by input method and deployment type.

item.title: text-embedding-3-large
item.description: text-embedding-3-large is the latest and most capable embeddings model for converting text into vectors for similarity and retrieval. Third-generation embeddings improve multilingual retrieval (MIRACL) and support a dimensions parameter to reduce embedding size for cost/performance control.

item.title: text-embedding-3-small
item.description: text-embedding-3-small is a third-generation embeddings model for text-to-vector conversion, offering improved multilingual retrieval performance versus older embeddings. It supports reducing embedding size via a dimensions parameter for cost/performance tuning.

item.title: text-embedding-ada-002
item.description: text-embedding-ada-002 is an older embeddings model (versions 1 and 2 listed) used to convert text into vectors for similarity and retrieval. The page notes you cannot upgrade between embeddings models; migrating to text-embedding-3-large requires regenerating embeddings.

item.title: gpt-image-1
item.description: gpt-image-1 is a GPT-image-1 series image generation model in limited access preview for generating images from text prompts. Access requires registration and eligibility approval, and it is available in specific Global Standard regions listed on the page.

item.title: gpt-image-1-mini
item.description: gpt-image-1-mini is a limited access preview image generation model in the GPT-image-1 series. It generates images from text prompts and requires registration for access, with Global Standard availability in the listed regions.

item.title: gpt-image-1.5
item.description: gpt-image-1.5 is a limited access preview image generation model in the GPT-image-1 series. It requires registration and is available in the listed Global Standard regions for image generation from text prompts.

item.title: dall-e-3
item.description: dall-e-3 is an image generation model that creates images from natural language prompts. It is generally available for REST APIs, while DALL-E 3 with client SDKs is in preview, and it is available in East US, Australia East, and Sweden Central.

item.title: sora
item.description: Sora is an OpenAI video generation model that creates realistic and imaginative video scenes from text instructions. It is in preview and available in East US 2 and Sweden Central (Global Standard).

item.title: sora-2
item.description: sora-2 is a newer Sora video generation model listed as NEW on the page. It remains in preview and is available in East US 2 and Sweden Central (Global Standard).

item.title: gpt-4o-mini-audio-preview
item.description: gpt-4o-mini-audio-preview is a GPT-4o family preview audio model for audio and text generation. It supports large token inputs and is intended for conversational or generative audio scenarios, but preview models are not recommended for production.

item.title: gpt-4o-audio-preview
item.description: gpt-4o-audio-preview is a GPT-4o family preview audio model for audio and text generation. It supports large token inputs and is part of the GPT-4o audio lineup where preview deployments may be upgraded automatically over time.

item.title: gpt-4o-realtime-preview
item.description: gpt-4o-realtime-preview is a GPT-4o family preview model designed for real-time audio processing. Multiple versions are listed (2024-12-17 and 2025-06-03), and it targets low-latency speech-in/speech-out interactions.

item.title: gpt-4o-mini-realtime-preview
item.description: gpt-4o-mini-realtime-preview is a GPT-4o mini family preview model for real-time audio processing. It supports low-latency audio interactions and is part of the preview audio lineup that is not recommended for production use.

item.title: gpt-realtime
item.description: gpt-realtime is a generally available (GA) audio model for real-time audio processing. It is listed alongside newer realtime and audio variants and is intended for low-latency conversational audio scenarios.

item.title: gpt-realtime-mini
item.description: gpt-realtime-mini is a smaller realtime audio model variant listed with multiple versions (including 2025-10-06 and 2025-12-15). It targets real-time audio processing with lower resource requirements than the full realtime model.

item.title: gpt-realtime-mini-2025-12-15
item.description: gpt-realtime-mini-2025-12-15 is a dated version of the gpt-realtime-mini model. It is intended for real-time audio processing and is listed as a distinct model ID/version in the audio models table.

item.title: gpt-audio
item.description: gpt-audio is an audio model listed for real-time audio processing use cases. It is part of the newer audio model lineup and is intended for audio-centric interactions and generation workflows.

item.title: gpt-audio-mini
item.description: gpt-audio-mini is a smaller audio model variant listed with multiple versions (including 2025-10-06 and 2025-12-15). It is intended for real-time audio processing with a smaller max request size than the GPT-4o audio preview models.

item.title: whisper
item.description: whisper is a general-purpose speech recognition model available via the Audio API for speech-to-text and speech translation. It supports audio file uploads up to 25 MB per request.

item.title: gpt-4o-transcribe
item.description: gpt-4o-transcribe is a speech-to-text model powered by GPT-4o and accessed via the Audio API. It supports audio file uploads up to 25 MB per request for transcription workloads.

item.title: gpt-4o-mini-transcribe
item.description: gpt-4o-mini-transcribe is a speech-to-text model powered by GPT-4o mini. It is available via the Audio API and supports audio file uploads up to 25 MB per request.

item.title: gpt-4o-transcribe-diarize
item.description: gpt-4o-transcribe-diarize is a speech-to-text model that includes diarization/automatic speech recognition features. It is available via the Audio API and supports audio file uploads up to 25 MB per request.

item.title: gpt-4o-mini-transcribe-2025-12-15
item.description: gpt-4o-mini-transcribe-2025-12-15 is a versioned speech-to-text model with improved transcription accuracy and robustness. It is available via the Audio API and supports audio file uploads up to 25 MB per request.

item.title: tts
item.description: tts is a preview text-to-speech model optimized for speed. It is used via the Audio API for generating speech from text.

item.title: tts-hd
item.description: tts-hd is a preview text-to-speech model optimized for quality. It is used via the Audio API for higher-fidelity speech generation from text.

item.title: gpt-4o-mini-tts
item.description: gpt-4o-mini-tts is a preview text-to-speech model powered by GPT-4o mini. It supports guiding the voice to speak in a specific style or tone via the Audio API.

item.title: gpt-4o-mini-tts-2025-12-15
item.description: gpt-4o-mini-tts-2025-12-15 is a versioned preview text-to-speech model powered by GPT-4o mini. It supports guiding the voice style/tone and is listed as a distinct model ID/version.

item.title: model-router
item.description: model-router is a Microsoft model that routes requests to underlying models to optimize for capability, cost, or context needs. It supports text and image input with a 200,000 token context window, and its max output tokens vary depending on the routed underlying model; version 2025-11-18 is noted with earlier versions also available.

item.title: o3-deep-research
item.description: o3-deep-research is listed in the model availability tables with a note that it is only available with Foundry Agent Service. It is associated with the Deep Research tool guidance and is not generally available as a standard model deployment.

item.title: FLUX.2-pro
item.description: FLUX.2-pro is a Black Forest Labs image generation and editing model that supports text and image prompts, including multi-reference inputs (up to 8 images via API). Key features include improved grounding in real-world knowledge, greater output flexibility, and enhanced performance, and it is available as Global Standard in all regions.

item.title: FLUX.1-Kontext-pro
item.description: FLUX.1-Kontext-pro is a Black Forest Labs in-context image generation and editing model accessible via Azure image endpoints and a provider API. It emphasizes character consistency and advanced editing, with provider-specific parameters such as seed and aspect ratio, and is available as Global Standard in all regions.

item.title: FLUX-1.1-pro
item.description: FLUX-1.1-pro is a Black Forest Labs text-to-image model available via Azure image generation endpoints and a provider API. It highlights fast inference speed, strong prompt adherence, competitive pricing, and scalable generation, and is available as Global Standard in all regions.

item.title: Cohere-rerank-v4.0-pro
item.description: Cohere-rerank-v4.0-pro is a reranking/text-classification model for ordering documents by relevance. It takes text input and returns JSON output across many languages, and is available via Global Standard in all regions and via managed compute.

item.title: Cohere-rerank-v4.0-fast
item.description: Cohere-rerank-v4.0-fast is a speed-optimized reranking/text-classification model for relevance ordering. It returns JSON output and supports many languages, and is available via Global Standard in all regions and via managed compute.

item.title: Cohere-command-a
item.description: Cohere-command-a is a chat-completion model optimized for use cases such as reasoning, summarization, and question answering. It supports tool calling and returns text or JSON, and is available via Global Standard in all regions.

item.title: embed-v-4-0
item.description: embed-v-4-0 is a Cohere embeddings model that supports both text and image inputs and outputs vectors in multiple dimensionalities. It is available via Global Standard in all regions and supports multiple languages.

item.title: DeepSeek-V3.2-Speciale
item.description: DeepSeek-V3.2-Speciale is a DeepSeek chat-completion model that includes reasoning content for step-by-step style reasoning tasks. It supports English and Chinese, returns text/JSON, and is available via Global Standard in all regions.

item.title: DeepSeek-V3.2
item.description: DeepSeek-V3.2 is a reasoning-capable chat-completion model (with reasoning content) aimed at language, scientific reasoning, and coding tasks. It supports English and Chinese and is available via Global Standard in all regions.

item.title: DeepSeek-V3.1
item.description: DeepSeek-V3.1 is a chat-completion model with reasoning content and tool calling support. It targets reasoning-heavy tasks in English and Chinese and is available via Global Standard in all regions.

item.title: DeepSeek-R1-0528
item.description: DeepSeek-R1-0528 is a reasoning-focused chat-completion model (with reasoning content) designed for complex reasoning tasks. It is available via both Global Standard and Global Provisioned managed deployments in all regions.

item.title: DeepSeek-V3-0324
item.description: DeepSeek-V3-0324 is a chat-completion model that supports tool calling and returns text/JSON. It is available via Global Standard and Global Provisioned managed deployments in all regions.

item.title: DeepSeek-R1
item.description: DeepSeek-R1 is a reasoning-capable chat-completion model (with reasoning content) intended for step-by-step reasoning tasks. It is available via Global Standard and Global Provisioned managed deployments in all regions.

item.title: Llama-4-Maverick-17B-128E-Instruct-FP8
item.description: Llama-4-Maverick-17B-128E-Instruct-FP8 is a Meta multimodal chat-completion model supporting text and image inputs with very large context and output limits. It is available via Global Standard in all regions and returns text output.

item.title: Llama-3.3-70B-Instruct
item.description: Llama-3.3-70B-Instruct is a Meta chat-completion model for instruction-following text generation. It supports a large input context and is available via Global Standard in all regions with text output.

item.title: MAI-DS-R1
item.description: MAI-DS-R1 is a Microsoft chat-completion model that includes reasoning content and targets reasoning-heavy tasks in English and Chinese. It is available via Global Standard in all regions and returns text output.

item.title: Mistral-Large-3
item.description: Mistral-Large-3 is a multimodal chat-completion model supporting text and image input with tool calling and text/JSON outputs. It is available as Global Standard in West US 3.

item.title: mistral-document-ai-2505
item.description: mistral-document-ai-2505 is an image-to-text model for extracting text from images or PDFs (up to 30 pages / 30MB). It outputs text/JSON/Markdown and is available via Global Standard in all regions and Data Zone Standard in the US and EU.

item.title: Kimi-K2.5
item.description: Kimi-K2.5 is a Moonshot AI multimodal reasoning model that accepts text and image input and returns text output with reasoning content. It supports tool calling and is available via Global Standard in all regions.

item.title: Kimi-K2-Thinking
item.description: Kimi-K2-Thinking is a Moonshot AI reasoning model described as the latest and most capable open-source thinking model. It supports tool calling with large context and output limits and is available via Global Standard in all regions.

item.title: grok-4
item.description: grok-4 is xAI's latest reasoning model with advanced reasoning and tool-use capabilities, designed for enterprise domains. It supports tool calling, is text-only (no image input), requires registration for access, and is available via Global Standard in all regions.

item.title: grok-4-fast-reasoning
item.description: grok-4-fast-reasoning is an efficiency-optimized Grok model that delivers near-Grok 4 reasoning capabilities with lower latency and cost. It supports text+image input and tool calling, and is available via Global Standard in all regions plus Data Zone Standard (US).

item.title: grok-4-fast-non-reasoning
item.description: grok-4-fast-non-reasoning is a Grok fast variant that can bypass reasoning for ultra-fast applications while still supporting tool use. It supports text+image input and is available via Global Standard in all regions plus Data Zone Standard (US).

item.title: grok-code-fast-1
item.description: grok-code-fast-1 is a fast and efficient reasoning model designed for agentic coding applications, trained on coding-focused data and demonstrations of tool use and safe refusal behaviors. It requires registration for access and is available via Global Standard in all regions.

item.title: grok-3
item.description: grok-3 is a non-reasoning model tailored for business use cases such as data extraction, coding, and summarization, with strong instruction following and a large context window. It supports tool calling and is available via Global Standard in all regions plus Data Zone Standard (US).

item.title: grok-3-mini
item.description: grok-3-mini is a lightweight reasoning model trained for agentic, coding, math, and deep science problems with test-time compute and adjustable thinking budgets. It supports tool calling and is available via Global Standard in all regions plus Data Zone Standard (US).

item.title: Ministral-3B (preview) (2411)
item.description: Ministral-3B (preview) is listed as a fine-tuning model option with global availability but not supported in standard regions for fine-tuning. It is a text-to-text model with unspecified training data and output limits marked as unknown in the fine-tuning table.

item.title: Qwen-32B (preview)
item.description: Qwen-32B (preview) is listed as a fine-tuning model option with global availability but not supported in standard regions for fine-tuning. It is a text-to-text model with an 8,000 token input and 32,000 token output limit in the fine-tuning table.
